clinical_study.brief_title: Safety and Feasibility of imILT Locally Advanced Pancreatic Cancer (LAPC)
clinical_study.official_title: Immunostimulating Interstitial Laser Thermotherapy in Patients With Locally Advanced Pancreatic Cancer: Results of a Prospective, Open, Non Comparative Study

brief_summary.textblock: 10 Patients with Locally Advanced Pancreatic Cancer, no further responsive to neoadjuvant treatments but with a Stage-III disease will be submitted to imILT (Immunostimulating Interstitial Laser Thermotherapy). Safety and feasibility of imILT on LAPC will be evaluated as primary objective. Secondary objectives will be QoL after imILT, study of the immune reaction after imILT, oncological analysis of patients suffering from LAPC submitted to imILT.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of participants with treatment-related adverse events as assessed by CTCAE v4.0

secondary_outcome.description: This will be determined by measuring plasma levels of various pro and anti-inflammatory cytokines and immune-related cells

secondary_outcome.measure: Quality of Life after the application of imILT on pancreatic cancer, using European Organisation for Research and Treatment of Cancer Quality of life Questionnaire C30

arm_group.description: 10 patients suffering from LAPC will be submitted to immunostimulating interstitial laser thermotherapy (imILT) in a single-arm setting

intervention.description: Through a laparotomy a laser device will be inserted into the locally advanced pancreatic cancer.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Diagnosis of stage III locally advanced pancreatic cancer
- No further neoadjuvant treatments are doable
- Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group performance status < 1
Exclusion Criteria:
- No other concomitant oncological treatments (hormonal, immunotherapies, etc)
- Suffering from other neoplasms
- Suffering from HIV
- Suffering from autoimmune diseases
- Concomitant medication with steroids
